intro: Scyphogyne eglandulosa, commonly known as the smooth scyphogyne, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
